78cb088f-2dda-475e-8923-d10b86589582.description: Earners of the Provide Responsible Gambling Services have achieved the skills and knowledge required to understand their obligations under the law in QLD, WA, NT. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to assist customers to gamble within appropriate limits.
78cb088f-2dda-475e-8923-d10b86589582.name: RSG - QLD, WA, NT

alignments.name: Customer Liaison Officer
alignments.description: The Customer Liaison Officer unit expands on the skills and knowledge learned in the unit SITHGAM001 Provide Responsible Gambling Services to assist venues and gaming staff meet the legislative requirements when working for or operating a gambling venue in Queensland.

alignments.name: Customer Liaison Officer - online
alignments.description: The Customer Liaison Officer unit expands on the skills and knowledge learned in the unit SITHGAM001 Provide Responsible Gambling Services to assist venues and gaming staff meet the legislative requirements when working for or operating a gambling venue in Queensland.

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge checks and online assessments, including a video assessment demonstrating how to implement responsible gambling practices and provide information and assistance to customers about problem gambling
Has demonstrated knowledge regarding responsible gambling service procedures according to relevant state and territory legislation, industry, organisational policy and codes of conduct.
Has shown the ability to communicate with appropriate personnel on gambling-related incidents, situations and their compliance with legislation and industry and organisational policy.
Has the knowledge to ensure gambling environmental features support responsible gambling policies within the scope of own responsibility.
Understands the need to provide accurate and appropriate information on problem gambling to customers on request.

d69c2785-caee-4aa4-a560-8e82d467e563.description: Earners of the Customer Liaison Officer badge have achieved the skills and knowledge required to meet legislative requirements when working in a gambling venue. They know how to actively assist patrons requiring assistance with gambling related problems and provide information to patrons regarding counselling services. They are able to actively assist patrons in providing information on self-exclusions and maintain relevant forms and registers pertaining to exclusions.
d69c2785-caee-4aa4-a560-8e82d467e563.name: Customer Liaison Officer - Online

badge_template_activities.title: The Customer Liaison Officer (CLO) course covers the skill and knowledge requirements common to Queensland.
Has the skills to provide assistance to patrons and staff with gambling related problems.
Has the knowledge to ensure venues comply with legislation regarding problem gambling.
They are able to assist and take direction from gaming support and/or counselling services.
Have the ability to assist patrons in providing information on self-exclusions and maintain all relevant forms and registers pertaining to exclusions.

7f9eee8b-2741-4291-93d4-5a8a551d2c80.description: Earners of the Customer Service badge have achieved the skills and knowledge which covers various areas of Customer Service. They know how to handle customer complaints, understand the various types of communication, understand the importance of personal presentation and customer relations. They understand the different types of conflict and how to resolve them within the workplace.
7f9eee8b-2741-4291-93d4-5a8a551d2c80.name: Customer Service

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge checks and online assessment
Has the knowledge and skills to effectively communicate and manage customer complaints
Understands what good customer service and relations is and can effectively deal with customers.

dc633de8-0aa5-4628-aa80-b911974beea6.description: Earners of the Barista Basics badge have achieved the skills and knowledge required to advise customers on coffee beverages. They know how to organise a coffee workstation, select and grind coffee beans, extract and monitor the quality of espresso and skilled in the texture of milk. They are able to serve espresso coffee to customers in a professional manner and are proficient in the cleaning of espresso and other coffee related equipment.
dc633de8-0aa5-4628-aa80-b911974beea6.name: Barista Basics

badge_template_activities.title: This individual has completed 6 hours of training.
This individual has knowledge on coffee, coffee brewing, coffee making, coffee tasting and barista skills
Successful completion of theory based assessments throughout the course
Knowledge in a variety of functions to prepare and present a range of hot beverages

ac3402c6-bed2-40c2-ac56-784d41734f2c.description: Earners of the Provide Responsible Service of Alcohol have achieved the skills and knowledge required to understand their obligations under the law in Queensland. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to identify customers to whom alcohol service may be refused and to responsibly assist customers to drink within appropriate limits. They are able to assist alcohol affected customers and have shown that they can refuse service to intoxicated customers in a professional manner.
ac3402c6-bed2-40c2-ac56-784d41734f2c.name: RSA - QLD

alignments.name: SIT20316 Certificate II in Hospitality
alignments.description: Study the Certificate II in Hospitality and get the tools you need to launch your hospitality career. We’ll help you develop practical foundation skills to give you the best start in the hospitality industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge checks and online assessments, including a visual observation of refusing alcohol service to an intoxicated customer.
Have the skills and knowledge to refuse sale or service of alcohol in a professional manner, state reasons for the refusal, and where appropriate point out signage.
Have the knowledge to provide accurate information to customers on alcoholic beverages according to organisation or house policy and government legislation.
Have the skills to prepare and serve standard drinks or samples according to industry requirements and professional standards.
Have the knowledge and skill to use appropriate communication and conflict resolution skills to handle difficult situations

55f32505-cd34-497a-8619-55223a83997a.description: Earners of the Food Hygiene badge have achieved the skills and knowledge required to implement food hygiene. They know how to maintain the correct standards of personal hygiene to reduce the risk of food-borne illness. They are also able to identify potential hygiene risks and implement the correct methods of cleaning and sanitising.
55f32505-cd34-497a-8619-55223a83997a.name: Food Hygiene

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of theory based assessments throughout the course
They understand the obligations of food handlers under current legislation and state laws.
They have the ability to identify potential hygiene risks and understand the correct methods for food handling and storage.
They have obtained the skills and knowledge to maintain the correct standards of personal hygiene and therefore reduce the risk of food-borne illness.

skills.name: Basic Principles Of Food Hygiene In The Production

461f3857-0286-4548-ad24-c90a6184951c.description: Earners of the Fire Warden badge have achieved the skills and knowledge needed evacuation coordination. They have the skills and knowledge to respond to a fire or other incident, evacuating building occupants safely and assisting with post incident procedures.
461f3857-0286-4548-ad24-c90a6184951c.name: Fire Warden

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of theory based assessments throughout the course
Have the knowledge and skills to successfully identify and report emergencies and hazards.
Understand how the emergency control organisation is structured and the correct procedures for emergency response.
Have the ability to spot hazards and the skills to safely control them.

60339dfb-277b-4fe1-9f94-f42d2ed50c8d.description: Earners of the Food Safety Supervisor have a fundamental understanding of the obligations of food handlers under current legislation in QLD, WA, NT and SA. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to implement procedures for food safety and control food hazards at critical control points. They are proficient in food safety monitoring processes and can identify and report practices that are consistent with the food safety program.
60339dfb-277b-4fe1-9f94-f42d2ed50c8d.name: Food Safety Supervisor

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge checks, online assessments and observation checklist completed by a supervisor.

Has the ability to follow all food safety policies and procedures correctly and consistently according to organisation food safety program requirements to ensure compliance of all food handling practices
Has the ability to complete food safety monitoring processes and complete documents as outlined in the food safety program
Has the skills and knowledge to identify and report practices that are inconsistent with the food safety program
Can identify potential hygiene risks and ensure the correct standards of personal hygiene for food handlers are maintained.

f4119436-4a0f-4659-8203-d36e077dbac3.description: Earners of the Food Safety Supervisor have a fundamental understanding of the obligations of food handlers under current legislation in NSW. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to implement procedures for food safety and control food hazards at critical control points. They are proficient in food safety monitoring processes and can identify and report practices that are consistent with the food safety program.
f4119436-4a0f-4659-8203-d36e077dbac3.name: Food Safety Supervisor NSW

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge checks, online assessments and observation checklist completed by a supervisor.

Has the ability to follow all food safety policies and procedures correctly and consistently according to organisation food safety program requirements to ensure compliance of all food handling practices
Has the ability to complete food safety monitoring processes and complete documents as outlined in the food safety program
Has the skills and knowledge to identify and report practices that are inconsistent with the food safety program
Can identify potential hygiene risks and ensure the correct standards of personal hygiene for food handlers are maintained.

skills.name: Basic Principles Of Food Hygiene In The Production

badge_template_activities.title: This qualification is ideal for those looking to increase their opportunities and gain the practical and theoretical skills to succeed in a business and hospitality environment.

3cfefa62-e649-4daf-9c57-d1fa42b4b1f0.description: Take the next step in your career with the Diploma of Leadership & Management. Get the tools you need to start your career in management.
3cfefa62-e649-4daf-9c57-d1fa42b4b1f0.name: BSB51918 Diploma of Leadership and Management

badge_template_activities.title: BSB51918 Diploma of Leadership and Management, to achieve this qualification you must complete 12 units of competency, consisting of 4 core units and 8 elective units

95d77722-fc63-4c73-b411-5e8ac3c98511.description: Earners of the First Aid Advanced badge will have successfully completed and be proficient in the following units - HLTAID001 Provide cardiopulmonary resuscitation, HLTAID002 Provide basic emergency life support, HLTAID003 Provide first aid and HLTAID004 Provide an emergency first aid response in an education & care setting
95d77722-fc63-4c73-b411-5e8ac3c98511.name: First Aid Advanced Training

badge_template_activities.title: Have the skills and knowledge to effectively provide cardiopulmonary resuscitation, basic emergency life support and provide first aid in an education and child care setting.

035a9986-25a7-423d-8f03-9302b71ee294.description: Earners of the First Aid Basics badge will have successfully completed and be proficient in the following units - HLTAID001 Provide cardiopulmonary resuscitation and HLTAID002 Provide basic emergency life support

9162b6e2-b7d3-44a2-a57b-b7106b279038.name: First Aid Intermediate Training

3b0a42b0-ca45-43a9-9e00-c070f4d4196b.description: Earners of the Gaming Nominee badge have achieved the skills and knowledge required to meet Queensland legislative requirements when working in a gambling venue. They have obtained an understanding of the legal responsibilities and best practice management techniques in accordance with the Gaming Machine Act (Qld).
3b0a42b0-ca45-43a9-9e00-c070f4d4196b.name: Gaming Nominee

badge_template_activities.title: The Gaming Nominee course covers knowledge of the legal requirements common to Queensland.
Has the knowledge regarding the latest Queensland gaming legislation and regulations.
Has knowledge regarding self exclusion provisions and the appeals procedure.
They are able to assist and take direction from gaming support and/or counselling services.
Have the ability to assist patrons in providing information on self-exclusions and maintain all relevant forms and registers pertaining to exclusions.

25b15708-3f34-42b0-b52f-f970e72eb92a.description: Earners of the Responsible Management of Licensed Venues (RMLV) have a fundamental understanding of the obligations for all licensees, nominees and applicants for a manager's licence. They understand their responsibilities under the Liquor Act 1992 and have learned a range of management strategies to assist in the responsible operation of a licensed venue. They understand how to use risk management and self audit processes for the continued safe and responsible operation of your business.
25b15708-3f34-42b0-b52f-f970e72eb92a.name: Responsible Management of Licensed Venues

Has the knowledge to understand their responsibilities under the Liquor Act 1992.
They have knowledge of a large range of management strategies to assist in the responsible operation of a licensed venue.
They have the skills and knowledge of risk management and self audit processes for the continued safe and responsible operation of your business.

c43ad722-cd8b-4fcb-9d72-84fe87724371.description: Earners of the Certificate II have a fundamental understanding of how to work effectively with others showing social and cultural sensitivity. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to safely interact with others by utilising their hospitality skills effectively. They are proficient in food safety, the use of hygienic practices and can provide responsible service of alcohol.
c43ad722-cd8b-4fcb-9d72-84fe87724371.name: SIT20316 Certificate II in Hospitality

badge_template_activities.title: Have the skills to work effectively with others showing cultural and social sensitivity.
Can utilise their skills and knowledge to work effectively with others in the workplace utilising safe work practices.
Completed and passed numerous written and practical assessments including work place observations.
Completed the certificate in hospitality consisting 12 units of competency, 6 core and 6 elective units.

08f05574-0436-48a6-ac53-5013a8ed9596.description: Earners of the Certificate II in kitchen operations provides a pathway to work in commercial kitchens. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to safely interact with others by utilising their hospitality skills effectively. They are proficient in food safety, the use of hygienic practices and can provide responsible service of alcohol.
08f05574-0436-48a6-ac53-5013a8ed9596.name: SIT20416 Certificate II in Kitchen Operations

badge_template_activities.title: Have the skills to work effectively with others showing cultural and social sensitivity.
Can utilise their skills and knowledge to work effectively with others in the workplace utilising safe work practices.
Completed and passed numerous written and practical assessments including work place observations.
Completed the certificate in hospitality consisting 13 units of competency, 8 core and 5 elective units.

f2d3e512-1452-4deb-b005-74522ee5b8e7.description: Earners of the Certificate III have a fundamental understanding of how to work effectively with others showing social and cultural sensitivity. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to safely interact with others by utilising their hospitality skills effectively. They have the ability to source relevant information to coach others within the hospitality industry, and they are proficient in food safety, the use of hygienic practices and can provide responsible service of alcohol.
f2d3e512-1452-4deb-b005-74522ee5b8e7.name: SIT30616 Certificate III in Hospitality

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the qualification in hospitality consisting 15 units of competency, 7 core and 8 elective units.
Completed and passed numerous written and practical assessments including work place observations.
Can utilise their skills and knowledge to work effectively with others in the workplace utilising safe work practices.
Have the skills to work effectively with others showing cultural and social sensitivity.

147585e9-3f98-4f02-9d02-8f7422df4447.description: Earners of the Certificate III in Commercial Cookery provides a pathway to work in commercial kitchens. They have achieved a wide range of well-developed cookery skills and sound knowledge of kitchen operations to prepare food and menu items. Using their discretion and judgement, they can work with some independence and under limited supervision using plans, policies and procedures to guide work activities.
147585e9-3f98-4f02-9d02-8f7422df4447.name: SIT30816 Certificate III in Commercial Cookery

badge_template_activities.title: Have the skills to work effectively with others showing cultural and social sensitivity.
Can utilise their skills and knowledge to work effectively with others in the workplace utilising safe work practices.
Completed and passed numerous written and practical assessments including work place observations.
Completed the certificate in hospitality consisting 13 units of competency, 8 core and 5 elective units.

09173c38-9c3e-4fd2-81b0-9c098e3bdb31.description: Earners of the Certificate IV have a fundamental understanding of how to work effectively with others showing social and cultural sensitivity. They know and have demonstrated the correct ways to safely interact with others by utilising their hospitality skills effectively. They have the ability to source relevant information to coach others within the hospitality industry, and they are proficient in food safety, the use of hygienic practices and can provide responsible service of alcohol.
09173c38-9c3e-4fd2-81b0-9c098e3bdb31.name: SIT40416 Certificate IV in Hospitality

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the certificate in hospitality consisting 21 units of competency, 9 core and 12 elective units.
Completed and passed numerous written and practical assessments including work place observations.
Can utilise their skills and knowledge to work effectively with others in the workplace utilising safe work practices.
Have the skills to work effectively with others showing cultural and social sensitivity.

d1c8ed72-cb88-4568-8511-b621a85aeafc.description: Earners of this Diploma have a fundamental understanding of how to lead and manage people , monitor workplace operations and roster staff. They have the knowledge to manage finances, prepare and monitor budgets and manage an operational plan. They have the ability to establish and conduct business relationships and ensure they are complying with regulatory requirements within the workplace.
d1c8ed72-cb88-4568-8511-b621a85aeafc.name: SIT50416 Diploma of Hospitality Management

badge_template_activities.title: SIT50416 Diploma of Hospitality Management, to achieve this qualification you must complete 28 units of competency, consisting of 13 core units and 15 elective units. The elective units listed are those which CTA Training Specialists trains (the final units that are selected from this list are dependent on qualification packaging rules which can be discussed with our trainers)
